content: What type of musical instrument is a Steinway & Sons Model D, commonly seen on concert stages worldwide?

A Steinway & Sons Model D is a grand piano, specifically the largest and most prestigious model produced by Steinway & Sons. It's often referred to as the "concert grand" due to its extensive use in professional concert halls and performances around the world. The Model D has a length of about 9 feet, which contributes to its rich, full sound and superior touch responsiveness, making it a favorite among pianists and composers.
